intro: Scleria neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as swampy forests and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes. Scleria neocaledonica is noted for its ecological importance in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
